p: Cutaneous lupus erythematosus (CLE) is a chronic autoimmune disease that may present with or without SLE, and can be divided into acute, subacute and chronic CLE subtypes (including discoid lupus erythematosus [DLE] as a major subtype). 1 2 Although the pathogenesis of SLE and CLE are not fully elucidated, genetic risk, environmental triggers and abnormalities in the innate and adaptive immune response have been implicated. 3 4
